allBlogPosts.title: Evolving MUI's core values and behaviors
allBlogPosts.description: After significant growth, we united as a team to rediscover the values that underpin our shared success.

allBlogPosts.title: The Tree View is moving to MUI X
allBlogPosts.description: Migrate to the new package to start building with our powerful Tree View, now part of MUI X. Previously released MIT components will stay MIT.

allBlogPosts.title: MUI X v6.11.0. A roundup of all new features
allBlogPosts.description: Support for time zones, Charts in alpha, Data Grid filtering, and more.

allBlogPosts.title: MUI is now on Discord!
allBlogPosts.description: Come join our community to engage in lively discussions, share your projects, and interact with the MUI team.

allBlogPosts.title: Introducing Toolpad: MUI's low-code admin builder
allBlogPosts.description: Assemble admin panels and internal tools faster than ever before with Toolpadâ€”now in beta.

allBlogPosts.title: MUI Core libraries support the Next.js App Router
allBlogPosts.description: Material UI, Base UI, and Joy UI are now compatible with the App Router as Client Components. Get started using the latest Next.js features with MUI!

allBlogPosts.title: MUI's team retreat in Chamonix
allBlogPosts.description: The MUI team spent five days in the French Alps team-building, problem-solving, and brainstorming. Read all about it!

allBlogPosts.title: Introducing MUI X v6
allBlogPosts.description: Introducing the new major version of the advanced components.

allBlogPosts.title: Date and Time Pickers revamped
allBlogPosts.description: Check out the new features coming in v6 beta.

allBlogPosts.title: An introduction to the MUI ecosystem
allBlogPosts.description: MUI is more than just Material UI. Consider Joy UI, Base UI, MUI X, and Toolpad for your next project.

allBlogPosts.description: Let us know what you want to see in MUI X v6 as we begin the alpha phase of development.

allBlogPosts.title: The MUI X Date and Time Pickers get a stable v5 release
allBlogPosts.description: Migrate to the latest version for improved DX, customizability, and API consistency.

allBlogPosts.title: Introducing Base UI: the headless alternative to Material UI
allBlogPosts.description: The Base UI component library gives you complete control over the look and feel of your app.

allBlogPosts.title: Strategies for building customizable components
allBlogPosts.description: Explore the tradeoffs between different customization techniques, and how we landed on our strategy at MUI.

allBlogPosts.title: Build layouts faster with the new Grid component
allBlogPosts.description: The new Grid v2 features simplified logic, support for offsetting and nested grids, and more.

allBlogPosts.title: Aggregate data like in Excel, but easier!
allBlogPosts.description: Aggregation functions and summary rows are now available in the MUI X Premium Data Grid.

allBlogPosts.title: MUI's company retreat in Tenerife: a recap
allBlogPosts.description: Our internationally distributed startup gathered on a remote island to get to know each other better. Here's what happened!

allBlogPosts.title: Why you should migrate to Material UI v5 today
allBlogPosts.description: We have completely revamped our Migration guide to reduce friction when upgrading to v5. Get started now!

allBlogPosts.description: We're excited to introduce callback support for global theme overrides in this minor version update!

allBlogPosts.description: The new row grouping feature gives your users more customization options for organizing their data.
